question: During the 1970s which car maker produced the Triumph TR7 and the Jaguar XJS?
vanilla_rag_result: During the 1970s, both the Triumph TR7 and the Jaguar XJS were produced by British Leyland. The Triumph TR7 was manufactured by the Specialist Division of British Leyland, while the Jaguar XJS was manufactured and marketed by Jaguar, which was part of the British Leyland group at that time.
